text: The 1989–90 NCAA Division I men's basketball season began in November 1989 and ended with the Final Four at McNichols Sports Arena in Denver, Colorado on April 2, 1990. The UNLV Runnin' Rebels won their first NCAA national championship with a 103–73 victory over the Duke Blue Devils. ==Season headlines== * Lionel Simmons became the first NCAA Division I player to score more than 3,000 points and gather more than 1,100 rebounds.
